Amy Schumer is f*&king funny! If you haven't watched Inside Amy Schumer or seen any of her stand-up then you're missing out. She is easily one of the funniest comedians working today, and I'm not going to insult her by adding the preface of "female" comedian because she is that damn funny. So what happens when the funniest comedian working today works with comedic director Judd Apatow, who to be fair has been a little hit and miss lately, does Amy stack up on the big screen? Due to some pretty poor parenting advice from her father as a child, Amy has become a commitment-phobic woman who has a great career, like everyone does in Apatow films, and essentially only believes in one-night stands. But when she meets a surgeon to sports stars, played by Saturday Night Live's Bill Hader, she becomes conflicted about her long held beliefs about what "monogamy" really means. Look, let's not beat about the bush, this is a Romantic Comedy, but a Romantic Comedy written by Amy Schumer and directed by the guy who gave us the 40 Year Old Virgin and Knocked Up, so it's fair to say that it subverts many of the common cliches and tropes of the genre. Schumer essentially has the traits of the male role reserved for Rom-Coms whereas Hader takes on the more feminine elements found in these types of movies, thus the film is refreshing. But even more so it's the raunchy comedy that pulls this out of the more cringe-worthy parts of the genre that drives most men into glazed over sacks that are just waiting for the end credits. The supporting cast around Schumer is magnificent. LeBron James is a real highlight of the film. Surprisingly, for a current sporting personality he provides a version of himself that is self-deprecating, needy and extremely funny. What's most amazing is that he doesn't make cheesy or eye-rolling references to his career, I could never see Dennis Rodman doing this in his acting career (or when people gave a shit about Dennis Rodman - if people ever did.) You also get a great comedic turn from Mark Wahlberg, sorry I mean John Cena, who looks like Mark Wahlberg ate Mark Wahlberg, he and Amy's sex scene is hilariously awkward. Bill Hader is a great leading man, very much in the same vain as Paul Rudd, he has the charm and the humour which makes for the perfect pairing for Amy Schumer. The other great casting is Tilda Swinton who is, much like in the movie Snowpiercer, completely unrecognisable as a downright despicable editor of a magazine called Snuff - she's so shallow and dismissive based on such purely superficial reasons that you don't know whether to punch her in the face or take a shower.It would have been incredibly easy for this film to just become a series of stand-up jokes delivered directly to the audience, however Apatow manages to blend much of Amy Schumer's stand-up material effortlessly into the story. In the hands of a lesser director, we would be getting lots of short unrelated comedy clips like we did in Ted 2 or A Million Ways To Die In The West, so this is not only great for Amy Schumer's debut but for us as an audience. The comedy can be on the nose at times, it can get a little dirty, well really dirty, like you might need a shower afterwards kind of dirty, but a lot of it comes off very relatable. It may get a little awkward at times when you're wife, girlfriend and partner starts laughing harder than you and starts saying between snorts "so true, so true..." Yeah, depending on the scene that could be an awkward conversation afterwards. Like many Apatow films there is always a strong desire to bring the serious moments into the really serious territory where it often hits a little too close to home and uncomfortable. Much like in the other Apatow films it doesn't really fit with the flow of the rest of the laugh out loud comedy. This is most likely due to Apatow's personal push for comedies to receive the coveted Oscar-nod via their own category of "Best Comedy" which is fine, but it shouldn't be at the expense of a comedy being a comedy. The film is clearly aiming to be an "Anti-Rom-Com" and it does succeed with this on many levels thanks to the raw realism of the modern dating scene and how we view sexual relationships, but the film does fall into stock-standard "Rom-Com" at times, particularly at the end. Thankfully, the film is far too enjoyable to hold that against it. Trainwreck gets Four and a Half out of Five Stars (or Four and a Half really awkward conversations with your partner about your sexual history)

Making her feature film debut, Amy Schumer brings her stand-up persona to life with aplomb and demonstrates some not-bad dramatic chops in the process. Trainwreck is plainly designed as a showcase for her talents and does an admirable job proving why she deserves to have a future on the big screen. Trainwreck does fall prey to some of the common romantic comedy tropes, slipping into predictability a bit in the third act. In addition, Judd Apatow's latest isn't immune from some of the shortcomings that typically befall his films. Nevertheless, Trainwreck puts the spotlight on a growing comedic voice in Schumer. While her style may be off-putting to some and occasionally bordering on blatant shock value, it is certainly one worth exploring, and her partnership with Apatow works well for both parties involved, as Trainwreck is anything but what its title implies.

Trainwreck is a solid film, and a great entry in Judd Apatow's already impressive filmography.

It's decent as a cheesy rom com, but as far as a raunchy comedy, completely missed the mark.The first twenty minutes seemed like a cheap amalgam rip off of Bridesmaids and Wedding Crashers.The middle part pretty much plays out like every Drew Barrymore rom com of the nineties and the end was like some weird Bollywood movie where people break out into dance numbers for no reason while inserting a paint by numbers ending to wrap it all up.Whoever told LeBron James that he should act should be shot in their balls. The WWE star provided a couple of laughs, that were few and far between, but by far the funniest person in the whole film, which is odd because Bill Hader is usually hilarious.Even though I somewhat enjoyed watching this film it is by far Judd Apatow's worst film that he has done. Going into Trainwreck I knew Amy Schumer was pretty funny and Judd Apatow was a hit-and-miss director. And this is a HIT! Probably because of Amy Schumer. She wrote and starred in Trainwreck. I'm sure Schumer had more than just a little say in how the movie turned out. The casting was amazing. I know who LeBron James is because he's a good basketball player and someone on his last team screwed his wife. I now also know he's a funny actor who seems to be comfortable in front of the camera. James owned every scene he was in. He had good chemistry with Schumer and Hader, which compensated for the lack of chemistry that Schumer and Hader had. Colin Quinn and John Cena pitched in to make Trainwreck better also. Cena showed that he has a good sense of humor. The worst thing is the run-time. 2 hours is a long time for this type of film, and it has a bit of drag toward the end. It ended up being worth it though.The lack of chemistry between Schumer and Hader that I mentioned earlier is also pretty big for a rom-com. Obviously it didn't kill Trainwreck, but two actors that seemed to get along even a little would have made it better. Trainwreck was smart and funny. It's worth watching when anyone gets the chance.

Saw TRAINWRECK today, a very funny Amy Schumer comedy. Like many of director Judd Apatow, it has emotional depth and is a little bit long, but it's fun and well acted. My heart goes out to those who died and got injured at the Trainwreck screening shooting in Louisiana cinema. When her magazine job leads her to interview a charming sports doctor, she finds herself falling for him - and maybe finding romance is just what she needs in her life.Okay I'm just going to say it, I never was a fan of Amy Schumer. I was never a fan of her work and to be honest I'm not such a big fan of her. I don't know what it is but these just something about her that I just can't put my finger on it. I only say I'm not a fan of her because I don't hate her as a person, because right now as I speak shes taking action on gun control because of the Louisiana cinema shooting that was showing Trainwreck. I'm happy that shes calling out this big issue that's still around and how this gun control problem needs to solved. A simple gun can land into the wrong hands. But all that aside I thought the movie Trainwreck wasn't all that great of a movie.The movie wasn't written that well, I mean the jokes in the movie got old after awhile. Some people say that the movie was well written but I must disagree. Amy Schumer did okay in the movie but these a couple of scenes in the movie that she didn't do such a great job, for example when shes at a funeral and she starts crying and the tears didn't look even remotely look like it was brought on by emotions the character was experiencing, it just looked like an actress trying to force whatever emotion to force out.While watching the movie I kept saying to myself "Is this real humor?" because the audience that I was with only chuckled a couple of times. There are a few gay jokes in the movie and that's mostly with John Cena who would say something and then somehow accidentally imply that he wants to have sex with another man and this joke happens too many times in the movie. That's pretty much the joke, now some many think I got offended by the joke but that's really not the case, I can laugh at many jokes that might be offence to some people who take it too seriously. The problem here is that there was no joke, gay was the joke. These many gay jokes out there that are funny if there's a joke behind it but not on it's own. Tilda Swinton was the only one to give a good performance in this movie. She did the best of what she had to work with by poor directing and the terrible script.The movie is called Trainwreck which is Amy Schumer character, which the movie keeps referencing about her alcohol and marijuana use but we only see her intoxicated in a couple of moments in the movie but after awhile the movie just tells you about it without Amy Schumer acting like it.Bill Hader was good in the movie but he didn't do anything special.Overall Trainwreck wasn't all that good to me. A lot of people may easily disagree with me on this one but this is just my honest thoughts on this movie. If you enjoyed the movie good for you.

Amy Schumer is a comedy assassin. Proof is in her hit Comedy Central series, Inside Amy Schumer, which takes on everything from rape culture to Hollywood sexism to Bill Cosby. Proof is also now in her starring role in Trainwreck. As star and screenwriter--with director Judd Apatow wisely harnessing her comic skills instead of stifling them--Schumer is a wonder of comic talent with an assault on sexism and man attitudes that hits hard.Amy is Amy Townend, a writer for a men's magazine run by an editor (a terrifically hilarious Tilda Swinton) who has a fondness for headlines such as 'Are You Gay Or Is She Just Boring?' Amy is tasked with interviewing Aaron Conners (Bill Hader), a sports-medicine doctor who tends to the celebrity likes of LeBron James (absolutely hilarious) and Amar'e Stoudemire.Sounds like a set-up for love, but hang on. Amy, sporting a mouth fueled by booze, weed and a clueless, neglectful father (a wonderful Colin Quinn) is game to hook up with almost any guy and then dump them. Aaron isn't quite one of those dudes, though the brilliant Hader, whose comic and dramatic skills hit a new peak, imbues him with complications. These two don't go together easy, and that's how Schumer likes it. Schumer takes rom-com cliches and explodes them, replacing them with something fierce and tougher. Here's to getting more of that from her.

Amy Schumer is not only SO hilarious, but she's a really good actor!! Bill Hader isn't your typical hunky leading man, but he has such depth and comedic timing that you can't help falling for him too! And LaBron, well - WHO KNEW! If you're going to get your panties in a bunch by F-bombs or promiscuous sex, then move on, but if you want to laugh your butt off and be respectfully offended, then this is your movie! P.S. Amy makes a hot cheerleader - GO AMY!!

Trainwreck is a romantic comedy directed by Judd Apatow and starring Amy Schumer and Bill Hader, and this film comes in very strong with the comedy. The romance side of the film kicks in about 30 minutes in, so for the first act of the film it really has some pretty damn good laughs. There was a pretty steady flow of jokes and comedy gags throughout the film and you have to give most of that credit to Amy Schumer who was incredibly hilarious in this. She is one of the funniest people out there today and she proves it in this film with perfect comedic timing. Her style of comedy is so blunt and fairly subtle at some moments and that makes it very unpredictable so she can hit you with great jokes left right and centre and you never see it coming. Now even though she does manage to pull it off the best, Bill Hader and the supporting cast are also hilarious and provided a lot more laughs than i had initially expected. Bill Hader of course is hilarious and he works in this film really well but he was slightly overshadowed by Amy at some moments in the film, and the large supporting cast also took away from him a little. But man were the supporting cast hilarious, i have to give credit to LeBron James because that guy is hilarious. He was one of the biggest surprises of the film, almost every scene he was in i couldn't stop laughing, it looks like Apatow and Schumer managed to teach him a few things in terms of comedy. As well as being jam packed with great hilarious moments this movie really had a basic but also pretty good rom-com story thrown in there. And it worked well, they didn't just force any random plot in there to add to the run-time. For the first two acts they did a great job at blending those comedic scenes and romantic more plot driven scenes well so they could switch between the two vary naturally. But the third act for me didn't work as much. The romantic side began to take charge and the comedy took a back seat. There were still some pretty funny scenes in the third act but it felt uneven tonally and a little jumpy. There was a pretty sad moment at one point then it tries to crack a few jokes immediately after then going back to the romantic stuff and it didn;t work for me as well as the rest of the film. I don't think it was an issue of being too long just needed a little more refining towards the end. But otherwise it was a great funny movie. Amy Schumer's comedy may not be for everyone so those who are not a fan of her 'Inside Amy Schumer' skits probably won't like this as much but as far as a romantic comedy goes, this one was actually very good and had quite a bit in there for everyone. - 7.1ALSO, on last thing, i just checked the list of cast and was surprised beyond belief when i found out that Tilda bloody Swinton was in this film. Like WTF? she was completely unrecognisable and hilarious, so see if you can pick her out when you see the film.

Jud Apatow is one of the most successful producer / directors in the modern adult comedy genre. His rambling improve-heavy comedies are a collection of hits and misses; from the massively successful 40 Year Old Virgin and Knocked-Up to failures like Funny People and This is 40. His style of comedy is basically a collection of You-tube like clips filled with filthy-mouthed characters improvising in front of the camera with the story never following a structure or a focused narrative. Trainwreck is Apatow's first directed comedy that's not written by him. This time, stand-up comedian Amy Schumer steps in as the star and the writer, which is a great change for Apatow's movies because they are generally male-oriented. The result of their collaboration is a funny, charming albeit flawed movie that could even be Apatow's best film to-date.Amy (Amy Schumer) is a commitment-phobic career woman living in Manhattan. Since she was a little girl, it's been drilled into Amy's head by her rascal of a dad that monogamy isn't realistic. Now a magazine writer, Amy lives by that credo - enjoying what she feels is an uninhibited life free from stifling, boring romantic commitment - but in actuality, she's kind of in a rut. When she finds herself starting to fall for the subject of the new article she's writing - a charming and successful sports doctor named Aaron Conners (Bill Hader) - Amy starts to wonder if other grown-ups, including this guy who really seems to like her, might be on to something.Schumer, whose stand-up career and Comedy Central series have earned her a passionate following (and a sizable number of haters) is poised for some serious stardom. Not only her writing smoothly switches tracks from raunchy one-liners to emotionally raw dialogue about commitment, family and self-destructiveness, but also she owns the movie. She takes central stage with her unique persona on display at all times. The movie is constantly funny from the opening scene when we meet young Amy and her sister listening to their father's advice. After that we are introduced to her life style, her narcissism and her terror of monogamy, which shows itself when her sort-of boyfriend wants to take things to the next level. The dialogue is crude, rude and sharp and the deliveries are mostly hilarious with Schumer essentially playing herself throughout the movie. It's obvious that she is emotionally connected with her written characters and knows the story well enough to make it look authentic and real on the screen. Her relationship with her dad and sister (both superbly played) are textured, charming and believable. On the other hand, her relationship with Hader seems a bit forced and scripted but the two actors work so well with each other that will make us go along with their impossible relationship. The biggest win for Trainwreck however, is that the jokes do work for the most part. The script allows most of the cast members to shine and deliver their funny lines in the most authentic way.The film has numerous problems however and some are the same flaws with every Judd Apatow movie. The story is a bit convoluted and unfocused at times and there are no excuses for this type of comedy to be this over-long. There are plenty of subplots that could have easily been trimmed or taken out and sometimes the film comes to a halt because a scene is going nowhere. Also, when the film tries to get deeper into Amy's character, this lack of focus begins to become a major problem. Instead of having more scenes about her inner desires and her relationship with her family, we get to see basketball cheerleaders, dating montages or satirical takes on the glossy magazine industry. And finally, the ending feels too romantic-comedy friendly and unbelievable which is a shame because a more daring or realistic ending could have made the film smarter and more grown-up.But despite all the problems with the unfocused narrative and over-long running time, Trainwreck ironically never goes of the rail. As far as modern day romantic comedies go, it is certainly among the best and certainly delivers the laughs. The acting is superb across the board and some of the dialogue driven scenes could even become classics in the future. It is far from perfect but it is by far Apatow's funniest movie and definitely worth watching.

I've been looking forward to seeing this. Amy Schumer is really funny, and I liked this her writing/Judd Apatow directing combination. It worked out really well. The thing that really sold it for me though is that I knew this was going to be funny. That part was obvious. What I didn't expect (and was pleasantly surprised by) were the more emotionally poignant moments. They were there, you felt them, and then you were laughing a moment later. The fact that we as an audience completely go along with it is proof of how strong this script really is. I really hope to see more writing from her in the future. The same goes for her acting. Honestly, really well done. I know I'm talking about Schumer a lot, and she is one of the main reasons that this movie works, but the rest of the cast is nothing to scoff at either. This is one of Bill Hader's more emotionally vulnerable roles that I've seen him do, and he does a really nice job. Brie Larson, Mike Birbiglia, and Colin Quinn are great as her family, they bring some of the more grounded moments to the movie. Then on the other side of the spectrum, you have Ezra Miller, Vanessa Bayer, Randall Park, and Jon Glaser as her really funny co-workers, and an unrecognizably hilarious Tilda Swinton as her boss. Also who knew that LeBron James and John Cena could act? And be funny? Super pleasantly surprised by that. I could literally keep talking about this. My only complaint is that it get a tad laggy in the middle and we all know how it's going to end. But honestly, who cares, because the ride getting there is a ton of fun.

From childhood, Amy has had it drummed into her that monogamy does not work. Her single life is great. Hot sex, hot job, hot apartment, shit sex from a hot boyfriend. Belly laugh central. Very touching and pretty much the comedy of the year.Watch it. No now!

Amy Schumer is the latest stand up comedian to break out in Hollywood and is well known for her brash and brilliant standup routines. She plays a young woman refusing to live a monogamous lifestyle following a childhood lecture from her father. Schumer plays the traditional "man" role. She has a string of relationships and refuses to get close to anyone. Working for a paparazzi style magazine titled S'Nuff she is instructed by her editor a wickedly funny Tilda Swinton (I'd swear it's based on the character from Absolutely Fabulous) to interview a sports surgeon played by Bill Hader and they fall in love which totally turns her life upside down.In many ways it's a standard rom-com but at least Schumer's wit keeps you on your toes. The cast is excellent and surprisingly LeBron and Cena are funny when they need to be but the standout for me is Swinton. Who knew she could do comedy. I should have known considering she is one of the finest actresses in the world today.It drags in the third act but it's still a worthwhile effort and fine comedy-drama. I'd imagine Schumer is about to ascend to serious stardom.

No nudity but lots of suggestive material and some raw language. It has many, many laugh out loud moments. At first you don't like the character also named Amy but by the end you are rooting for her. A good date movie. (But see Mission Impossible first). Scott T

THE GOOD: I signed up for laughs, and Trainwreck delivers.THE NOT SO GOOD: For the most part you're set up with a heightened, goofy world with outrageous characters, but then the film comes back down to earth when its characters face some emotionally tough shit. Schumer and Brie Larson do an especially good job there, but such abrupt changes in tone/style threw me off guard, and I found it hard for my empathy to catch up. SIDE NOTE: Can't shake the feeling that this may be the first in line of many future films starring Amy Schumer as herself. She named her character Amy for goodness' sake. Seth Rogen would be proud.

So you know that movie that a couple of people are laughing really hard in the theater, but some people are wincing. I felt like that yesterday when I decided to beat the heat in my non-air conditioned house and go to a movie. The women sitting behind me and I were laughing loud and proud, but sooome people didn't find it that funny or were laughing secretly because their date didn't find it funny. So this movie is not for everyone, but it is for the lovers of Amy and Bridesmaids. I would go as far to say it is one of my all time favorite rom-com's. Trainwreck: How Do I Hate Thee?I've been holding back on this rant for a week now, but seeing "Trainwreck" certified fresh on the movie site Rotten Tomatoes has pushed me over the edge. Apparently every other living human being besides myself and the friend I saw the movie with thinks "Trainwreck" is hilarious, wonderful and ground-breaking. I found it sad, poorly plotted, and only intermittently funny. I almost feel as if I've entered an alternate universe where I had to watch a bad version of a movie that's supposed to be fantastic. At any rate, here is a roll-call of my reasons for spurning the movie.Let's begin with those reviews. The New York Times lauded "Trainwreck" and its writer and star Amy Shumer as "transgressive," praising the movie's heroine for "owning her sexuality" and for the daring subversion of gender norms whereby a woman is heartless and insensitive and the men around her are caring and hoping for commitment and monogamy. I shouldn't have read the reviews. They built up the hope that I was going to see a new "Bridget Jones' Diary" or "Four Weddings and a Funeral," each funny and modestly transgressive in their own ways.Amy Shumer's character (named Amy, wow) in "Trainwreck" drinks and smokes pot to excess and has sex with anyone who will take her home with him, but won't remember who she slept with in the morning or where she is. This is not transgressive, friends. This is not "owning your sexuality." It's stupid, unsafe and depressing, and it's not even amusing. Callous, joyless, commitment-free humping is no funnier when a woman does it than when a man does, and Shumer --although she gets in some funny lines-- does nothing to make a case to the contrary.Worse, there is very little sign that "Amy" enjoys the sex she's having. Most of the time she's complaining about it or clearly underwhelmed by it. Even when she hooks up with the man who becomes her love interest, she spends the post-coital afterglow carping at the man about his breathing and her aversion to spooning. Ha, ha, ha. A pathological inability to be truly intimate. Hilarious.Shumer is appealing and sometimes very funny, with the blond, squinty-eyed charm Renee Zellweger brought to "Bridget Jones." One of the highlights of this lamentable film is that Amy never doubts that men want to sleep with her or worries about her attractiveness. Her neuroses involve a desire to avoid the closeness that commitment and monogamy have a tendency to engender. "Monogamy is for suckers," as her dad says at the beginning of the movie. Of course in "Trainwreck's" present, that formally swinging dad is afflicted with MS and chained to a wheelchair, suggesting that he (and anyone pursuing that path) will pay for their aberrations via cosmic retribution. (A suggestion, by the way that is horrifying in its insensitivity on so many levels.)The movie presents us with a character who abuses drugs and alcohol, sleeps around, has no real friends, and is intermittently hostile to her "normal" sister, the sister's odd but rather dear stepson and bumbling husband. O.K. Fine. I may not buy that as entertaining, but it's a formula that worked in "Absolutely Fabulous." The problem is that, once it has given us this model, "Trainwreck" then proceeds to prove it was all a sham. Amy isn't really like this. She was just waiting for the right man to come along, her outrageously irascible father (now HE'S funny) to perish, various other vicissitudes to occur, and a dance sequence to unfold for true love to triumph. "Ab Fab" was successful for those who liked it because Edina and Patsy were always and everywhere horrible, and nothing on earth could redeem them from the selfish, horrid harridans they were.What is most troubling is how the movie attempts to recast Amy as sympathetic, likeable and "worthy" of entering into a traditional heterosexual romantic coupling with --here's some transgression for you-- a young, caring, wealthy doctor. It does so by debasing her work and her sexuality. In the film's comic and narrative nadir, when she and the doctor break up, a drunk and high Amy goes home with a co-worker who turns out to be under-age. The episode ends in humiliation and disaster for Amy. Proving what? That her fun and fancy-free life of drug-addled boffing is an empty, dangerous exercise in futility? That the audience permitted itself to be misled into thinking this was a movie that celebrated a woman's right to be just as carefree and single as a man a la Samantha Jones in "Sex and the City"? Search me.Having proven Amy is an unethical, damaged person and made its comic bed with her, the movie refuses to lie in it. I might not have liked "Trainwreck" if it had stayed with the original premise, but I would have . . . ahem . . . respected it in the morning. The bait and switch destroyed that possibility, but apparently just for me.Oh well. LeBron James was funny. Sigh.
just saw and loved this film--very funny, and very heartfelt--the promotion makes it seem more crass than it is--Amy Schumer is a wonderful talent

Trainwreck would not work at all if it weren't for one Amy Schumer. Her script is sharp, funny, and surprisingly heartfelt and her performance is the same. Her effortless charm anchors this movie and even pulls it out of a few iffy spots. She also imbues a surprising amount of dramatic depth to her character, which may have come off as one note in the hands of another. Come for the refreshing female perspective of commitment, stay for the brilliance of Schumer.

Wasn't an Amy Schumer fan, but am a Judd Apatow and Bill Hader fan- this changed my mind about Amy Schumer, she really is funny and this film while it is hilarious, it has gentle, warm moments that make it not only funny but a good film.

As an Amy Schumer fan, I went in expecting to laugh myself to tears. While it was a funny film, it felt like they were holding Amy back comedy wise. The good news is that she got to show some chops as a serious actress and had some pretty powerful serious moments.

I just got back from seeing Trainwreck and I have to tell you that this is not edgy writing and it is not a very funny movie either. When Le Bron James and John Cena two sports personalities in cameos are funny and are better actors than the leading lady then you know you've got a really bad movie on your hands. The premise of the movie is horribly unbelieveable as I could not possibly see anyone really wanting to be in a relationship with this woman. I thought it just might be me, but you know what a half full movie theatre was eerily silent which means that Ms Schumer is the darling of the press crowd right now. They have taken her under their wing and are now promoting her as the next big thing. She may be a talented stand up comedian but she is not a good actress. This movie is two stars out of four at best and it is sad that this film passes as a great comedy.In real life if an adult is caught trying to have sex with a 16 year old by the boy's mother, the police are called and it is treated as a sexual assault. IT IS NOT A JOKE!!!

As the writer and the lead actress, Amy Schumer really should have given herself better non-raunchy scenes. They are occasionally funny but it seems more that she just says inappropriate remarks until someone laughs. The best scenes seem to be between Bill Hader and Lebron James who oddly feel like true close friends during their scenes. Until the end I was unsure if I liked the movie. It is a good movie that you may want to watch twice but not for the reasons you thought when first walking into the movie.
Much funnier than I expected.
More a Schumer film than an Apatow film, if you like her brand of comedy, this movie is for you.

I hate rom-coms. I mean, I really, really hate them, with a passion... but Trainwreck is different. Different in the best of ways, but I won't go into it because I think it would be best to see this movie without expectations or any spoilers of any kind/level. However, I will say this: Amy Schumer is hilarious and the script she has written for this film is pretty damn close to perfect. This movie is another rarity, especially within its genre, but unlike most rom-coms, Trainwreck deserves financial success and popularity. This movie deserves sold out tickets. This film deserves recognition and respect. Most of all, Trainwreck deserves a chance. So, give it a chance and go see it. I promise you won't regret it. It's also a great date movie as well as a good movie to see alone. Go see this movie ASAP. I give Trainwreck an A.

It was an amazing film. This year I learned about Amy Schumer and all her greatness and when I heard about this movie I as excited, but scared at the same time. Would it live up to the hype? Well it certainly did. Amy's comedic brilliance is displayed perfectly in this film as well as her cast members. I also enjoyed the fact that this was a more realistic version of a romantic comedy with a scenario that is more realistic to the world we live in today. I hope that others will follow and will Amy her best in all her future endeavors.
The movie is appropriately titled. It was a total trainwreck. The movie had too many stops and no destination, it was completely derailed with a driver asleep at the switch. What a waste of talent.

I've never been a big fan of Amy Schumer's style of humor, dating back to her days on Fuse when she co-hosted that music show with Mark Hoppus. Even though it doesn't mean much, Trainwreck is the best thing I've seen her do, and a definite step in the right direction for her and her career. It has many funny parts and she does a good job acting in the more serious moments, but it's her writing that paints herself into a corner. She makes her character so, shall we say rough around the edges, that it robs the story of most of its sympathy and forward momentum. I suppose you could argue she did it to set up a redemption arc of sorts, but the way the movie peters out at the end doesn't deliver that, either. Anyway, the best part was clearly seeing LeBron act, who was hilarious in his limited screen time and stole the show along with Bill Hader, who for some unbeknownst reason is really smitten with Amy. Overall, Trainwreck is a step above your typical romcom, but Schumer and Judd Apatow never really come close to transcending it.

I definitely laughed in this film, there is no lie in that, but trainwreck is very slow-paced, unless you are a true lover of romantic comedy which i am not the biggest fan of, but can stand it. You will love this movie if you like rom-com but if not you could only just stand it.

Trainwreck, that is definitely what this is not. What this is a very well written, well acted and very funny movie and even though not all the jokes work, the ones that do are hilarious. Amy Schumer makes her big screen debut and is mostly a huge success. I'm surprised that a lot of other stand up comics don't do this, write their routine into a movie, I think most of them could succeed, unless they aren't as good of a script writer because Schumer's script is great, it's witty, it's quick, it's smart, it's funny and it has a heart, that and the almost can't miss Judd Apatow directing makes this a winner. Schumer plays a monogamistic writer with a fear of commitment, until she meets Aaron, who falls deeply in love with her, and she falls (literally) for him. She's a drunk and a pot head and she's slept with every guy in New York, but he doesn't care, he still loves her, and that is the key to this whole movie is no matter what she does or who she hurts, he still loves her, and she doesn't know why. The supporting cast is good here but Schumer is the star, and she makes herself out to be one. RECOMMENDED for Amy Schumer (if you like her comedy, but I still think you should give it a chance even if you don't), the writing and the laughs...and of course the HUGE heart at the end, and also John Cena's small role, which I forgot to mention.

Awful movie and downright boring. Given Amy Schumer's standup I hoped for something really go for broke funny like Bridesmaids but Trainwreck came across like an after-school special. I'd like to blame Judd Apatow for this mediocre comedy-drama but Amy wrote it. A huge disappointment.

This movie was much better than I thought it would be. Makes you squirm in your seat at times, it makes you so uncomfortable. You'll laugh, cry and root for all the main characters.

Some seriously funny moments and some very serious moments I wasn't expecting. There are some deep insights into human behavior, typically followed with non-sequitur humor of the lowest form. It does fall into one of Norman Denzin's Hollywood fallacies about Alcoholism: the love of a good person (man in this case) can cure someone of alcoholism.

Wanted to like this movie but completely disappointed that the main character was generally an unlikeable and selfish with most of the humor based on sex--all indiscriminate and at one time, illegal. In fact, this was barely a step above soft porn. I hope this is not a commentary on dating and the single life. I am 61 (married for 35 years) and saddened that this movie has received such favorable reviews.I am not trying to be a prude, I am thinking Emperor Amy has no clothes...who is willing to say so? Come on movie industry, we can do better!
Shouldn't the protagonists of a Rom-Com at least be likable?

I do not understand why the whole fuzz about it. I saw the movie and it was ok, but not great. In some instances the movie was a little bit boring. For those who have not seen it yet... wait until it comes to Redbox/DVD..

Laugh-out-loud acidic one liners, unexpected heart, and casting that pops make up for the Hollywood rom-com template that makes itself obvious by the finish line. Nonetheless, Schumer is the real deal.
Fun movie but sometimes could have been less raunchy without losing anything. Amy Schumer is hilarious with lots of laughs. Bill Hader played a good straight man.
Unfortunately, this IS my sister.

An excellent movie! Apatow seems to be greatly influenced by the spirit of Woody Allen in this Manhattan-set flick about love and relationship fears. Schumer and Hader have awesome comedic chemistry that really works. She should be up for Best Screenplay when the Oscars come around. A very creative film that is very well executed! Highly recommended!!
Brilliant and hilarious script, and quite touching at times. The leads were great. Also, John Cena and Tilda Swinton were suprisingly effective in supporting comic roles.

It's Judd Apatow in all his glory. Though HILARIOUS at times, it also has a few jokes miss the spot. For me, Lebron James and John Cena steal the show every time they are on screen. But I feel as though Judd coulda found a thousand better actresses for the role of Amy.

The movie started out a bit strong with the language but I was only able to stay for half of the movie as I was called out due to my job, I returned to see the rest and I'm so glad I did. The movie was touching, funny, full of surprises with various people, and the lead actors were beyond what I anticipated. Hooray for the movie, go watch it people.

I seen the movie 'Trainwreck', and I think the shooter on Thursday in the cinema was reacting to the storyline of the movie. It was way too long, and all of the sports celebrity appearances seemed very forced.The movie shouldn't have tried as hard as it did at drama, though the funeral scene was actually good.The movie was good for crude laughs with a fair amount of jokes that missed, but no one was mistaken that the story was built to make scenes for the comedy. Rent if you have time to kill or really love Amy Shumer...
Amy is just too gross.

Trainwreck follows the Judd Apatow formula, add a bunch of dirty jokes, a lot of witty lines and comebacks, the subtle build up and hilarious punchlines that follow, some heartbreak and emotion, and to top it all off the sense that everything will be ok. Amy Schumer's writing helps this formula come together. She follows her routine of vagina jokes, and her "I'm loose and fine with it". Although the movie could of done away with hundreds of these, and at points of the movie you find yourself with a blank stare hearing all them, Schumer delivers a fantastic performance proving she is more then capable of handling lead roles with her fantastic ability to switch off the humor and bring emotion that feels genuine. Along with the countless cameos including a surprisingly comedic performance by NBA star Lebron James and WWE wrestler John Cena, we get a terrific performance by the hilarious Bill Hader. Hader takes on a whole new role that you usual don't see him do. Hader known for his hilarious character acting on SNL, is able to deliver as a toned down and basic character but also maintain his comedy throughout the film. The movie is quite long for the story which probably could of been cut down a bit, and it may be a movie you won't feel the need to see twice, Trainwreck is worth seeing. I wouldn't rush to the theater but if you ever find yourself bored or willing to wait for the DVD release, take the time to sit down and enjoy the rom-com for what it is.

This movie actually helped me LIKE Amy Shuler and appreciate her sense of humor. I knew she was raunchy but ... she can act, it showed a side to her that made her raunchiness appear more like a gift then her just being .... well .. raunchy. I laughed so hard at points I cried. Don't bring your Mom!
Good funny movie - probably can be enjoyed just as much on small screen.John Cena is Fuck'n hilarious. LeBron James does extremely well too. Very sweet comedy in the end
Not up to par with Apatow's others, it doesn't maintain the heart, but it's funny in spurts, if inconsistent.
A solid but unspectacular entry into the Apatow filmography with LeBron surprising as the comedic savior for what would have been a less than amusing run of your mill rom-com.
The trailer looked fantastic, but I was underwhelmed by the actual movie. Such a tease... maybe that was a clever thematic move? Who knows.
Amy is wonderful as always.....lots of fun!!!! Great summer movie the cameos are surprising.
Starts off with one of the funniest scenes I have witnessed since the turn of the century. Not so much as goes downhill from there, it just wanders about.

Not overly funny or well paced and at 2 hours and two minutes it was way too long. Schumer is amusing, but Bill Hader, as usual steals the show, and really great assist from Lebron James and Tilda Swinton.
Trainwreck was just that, a trainwreck. For a movie that was supposed to not follow the normal romcom formula, it did just that while trying to yell about how it wasn't.

Saw it last night and women comedians dominate the big screen. The pro athletes were funny especially LeBron! Great acting and Judd Apatow again directs brilliantly but with his cast how could ? Amy Schumer's writing makes you want more and now for the next movie! writes like her stand-up, great!

this falls somewhere between Hangover and Bridesmaids, it's funnier than Bridesmaids but definitely not as funny as Hangover (the first one of course) maybe I gave it 3.4 stars because it has been so long since even a remotely funny Romantic Comedy has come out, don't even remember the last one

This movie is HILARIOUS! I'm a big fan of Amy Schumer as a comedian and now as a writer and actress. The story is somewhat formulaic and predictable but the execution is tight and great. Amy Schumer and Bill Hader have awesome chemistry and prove that they are great leads and Collin Quinn, John Cena, LeBron James and Brie Larson all have fantastic supporting roles. This is a high recommendation from me and by far Judd Apatow's best work in my opinion. This movie really isn't great for kids as it has a TON of strong sexual dialogue and some pretty raunchy sex scenes that only show male rear nudity. The Language is very strong with a ton of f-bombs, some used sexually. The main character also drinks a ton and smokes some pot a few times in the film. This is definitely a hard-R comedy but one highly recommend you check out. Hashmov
It's refreshing that comedian Schumer takes neither herself or her outrageous, laugh-a-minute, semi-biographical film too seriously.

I went to see this today, and this was one of the funniest movies I've seen in a while. I thought the acting was great, and the store was really good.

What am I missing here? Schumer is an outstanding and smart standup comedian, but dear god this movie literally hit every dumb cliche imaginable. It honestly felt like the joke was one me. Predictable. Unintelligent. Unfunny. Three strikes you're out... how's that for cliche and over used.
Funny and many laugh out loud moments. Amy Schumer was great in this movie and really pulled it off:)

The good news is that it is not... Spoiler: Some people have low self-esteem and this leads to commitment issues. But it is OK live a girl meets boy and work through issues real life. Or is that a long subtitle. There are a good number of laughs. There are plenty of funny people in the movie for SNL and elsewhere. LeBron James and John Cena do some nice featured B-character work. Every Judd Apatow Film feels like its 15 to20 min to long
I haven't laughed as hard in a theatre since "Bridesmaids".

I saw "Trainwreck" tonight with Camille. First off, the obvious: Amy Schumer is very talented and very funny. Judd Apatow surrounds her with a great cast as well. (It was fun for me, a long-time SNL fan, to identify all of the SNL cameos.) LeBron James is actually awesome in the film. If he didn't have that basketball thing going on, I think he could definitely make it in comedy films. John Cena was hilarious as well, definitely playing against type. (After some of his scenes, let me just say that I'll never be able to watch him in wrestling the same way again.) Bill Hader, who I am a big fan of, did a great job as well; he was funny as ever but also brought some humanity to a script that at times went maybe just a little too wacky in contrast to what they were doing in the rest of the film. Like many Judd Apatow films, it's a bit too long for a comedy, and what was a subversive take on the typical rom-com gets a little too formulaic at the end. (However, going off the rails is sort of the point of this film, right?) All of that being said, Amy Schumer is charming and winning, and we enjoyed a good, raunchy time. You can't ask more than that sometimes. ROTTEN TOMATOES SCORE: 3 1/2 stars. IMDB SCORE: 7/10.
Trainwreck is just a wreck. Started off good, but then just too long and too much drama about life without being very romantic. Amy Schumer is no Melissa McCarthy.

Funny sometimes, boring other times. The story and characters work well, but there are too many "humor" scenes that drag on a bit long without moving the story forward. Lots of raunchy sex scenes that made me cringe more than laugh. Good payoff at the end with humor and warmth.
One of the funniest movies that I've seen in a LONG time. Great acting, great cameos, and had some touching moments mixed in too. Definitely recommend.
Amy Schumer and Bill Hader have surprising chemistry. Great date movie.
Amy Schumer and Tilda Swinton were awesome but it ultimately devolves into a conventional romantic comedy where the woman subjugates to whatever the man wants.

Great comedy! Amy Schumer is great in her movie lead debut, Bill Hader is great as always, but the star of the movie, who steals all of the scenes, is none other than LeBron James - amazing screen debut! Highly recommended summer comedy!

4 out of 5 stars. Funniest movie in a long time. Dozens of laughs from beginning to end. Amy Schumer wrote the classic script as a star making vehicle for herself and she delivers like a freight train.

"Trainwreck" is a refreshing take on the popular rom-com, proving Schumer as one of the best female comedians in the game and uplifted by Hader's lovable character. Apatow has found a niche again that we haven't seen as well delivered since "The 40 Year-Old Virgin." Packed with belly-laugh material and some of the best modern comedy out there, "Trainwreck" is the must-see summer comedy of the year, and exhibits fantastic work from Amy Schumer (who also wrote the film).
Other than the parts seen in the trailers, movie is uneven and forced humor. Its a way to kill a few hours, not much more.

Comedy is subjective and depending on the type of comedy, divisive as well. Divisive is how I feel about this movie. A weird expression, but I think it fits well.The humor in the movie worked pretty well with a few hilarious scenes and a couple that might've gone on just a bit too long. Amy does well playing a bachelorette that just wants to get laid regularly, preferably by different people. I was disappointed with how subdued Bill Hader was as "dude-who-meets-the-protagonist's-match", but I guess someone's gotta play it straight. LeBron probably impressed me the most as he seemed to enjoy making fun of his super-star image and gets a decent amount of screen-time.My major issue with this movie is the last half-hour. We're chugging along with some funny here and there and then BOOM, a huge tonal change happens and character(s) start doing the opposite of what they'd been doing the first ninety minutes. It tries to sell you a "this is why they're acting like this", but I didn't buy it.I'm also not the biggest fan of Amy, maybe because most of her routine in this movie is rooted in disgust at something in a never-ending sarcastic manner. Either way, I really wish Apatow hadn't shoehorned in that last thirty minutes to make it fit his rom-com formula. I would've enjoyed it, otherwise.

A commitment phobic woman meets the opponent of her love life, a good guy. Amy Schumer and Bill Hader have great chemistry in this genderbent rom-com that is both raunchy and endearing. The movie only falters for the finale, when it falls prey to cheesy and sappy moments, but overall its a fresh and enjoyable comedy from one talented lady.
It was really entertaining. It dragged a tiny bit towards the end, but otherwise was engaging and super funny.

Not a great showcase for Amy Schumer. Unless she wants to be known for crass, vulgar adolescent humor. Some very funny MOMENTS and a couple of touching scenes are swallowed by an overall weak script. Bill Hader does a great job pulling off the straight-guy in a believable way. But the "chemistry" between the two is forced. It's one of those films that you never care to see again once you sat through it. If you get through the first 20 minutes, it DOES improve a little.
Amy Schumer does a fantastic job writing and starring in the film. One of the best comedies so far this year.

For those who are wondering about what Writer / Actress /comedian Amy Schumer is all about - I believe you see the true real Amy -- with all her self doubts / wanting to be all things to those important in her life--while fighting self doubts & flaws ---as she searches for career success, love, and self . Bill Hader plays the perfect foyle established surgeon who attempts to help Amy become comfortable with her doubting self. Interesting edgy RA Reviews
Soooo funny!! Schumer + Appatow = Little bit of pee in the pants.

Trainwreck really surprised me! It is a genuinely hilarious and heartfelt film with some jokes that almost had me in tears! The writing is amazing, the characters are loveable and the story, though clich�d, is interesting. The jokes are consistent and might have one of my favourite cameos I've ever seen! Even though it is slow and predictable, it is easily Judd Apatow's best film in a long time! See it!

Trainwreck is a pretty good comedy film but it's not as great as everyone says it is. Some people believe it's the funniest film of all time and some think it's the best comedy of this decade so far but I would have to disagree with them. The film is funny but it's not gut busting laughing. The laughs are more of a chuckle. The acting is great everyone played their part very well. Amy Schumer wrote this film and I think she did a great job for writing this film. The chemistry between her and Bill Hader is great. Also this is probably Judd Apatow's best film since 40 Year Old Virgin. The film is more of a chick flick but there are some chick flicks that I thought were funnier than this film like Bridesmaids. Also this could be a great date film for couples. I do find this film way over-hyped and probably one of the most overrated films so far this year. Overall if your a fan of Amy Schumer or Judd Apatow then you'll enjoy this film.

"Trainwreck" has few things going for it, and none to the point of anything original or extraordinary. Schumer, as both the writer and star, attempts to attack conventional romantic comedy, but results in only making the very thing she's out to knock. It's gender-swapping of the norms, but without giving anything to new to the craft. The best of this movie is driven by the comedians that are given bit parts and cameos (Colin Quinn as Amy's masoginistic and crass father, Mike Birbiglia as her dopey brother-in-law, and Dave Attell's lovable homeless guy), as well as LeBron James playing the super-BFF to Bill Hader's Aaron. Schumer is obviously very talented, but perhaps director Judd Apatow allowed her too much control in her first big screen attempt.

Very disappointing. Barely held together as a movie, thie feature was more like a collection of skits; Amy was her usual self (playing a woman named Amy, obviously), but Bill Hader played the more straight-arrow role of a doctor, and wasn't given many opportunities to be as funny as I would have hoped. The movie also didn't need to be as long as it was (clocked in right around two hours).
Hilarious movie with an serious message! Expected more comedy. The sex-parts where at one point to much and to cheesie.. But after all a great feel good movie.

A tad too long and some of the jokes didn't fully work for me but man this is funny. The fact Amy Schumer can stay on this level of comedy for more than an hour is impressive. The best parts of the movie are the dramatic, heartfelt moments which made me a little teary eyed.Total winner.

We all knew Lebron was a good actor from watching him in the NBA, but a big surprise comes from the two leads, the unexpected Amy Schumer and the typically quirky Bill Hader. The rom-com genre has been overused too many times for me to care to mention, but somehow Trainwreck manages to bring something new, with ramped up raunch and some legitimately touching and relatable moments. It's worth seeing, especially if rom-coms are your thing.

Had great expectations for this movie but, most disappointed The language and continual portrayal of women in bed was just not appealing for the grandmother that I am. Comedy was so lacking. Story was good but not really developed as it should could easily have happened. Just not right for he younger audiences.

Just average. I had feared it would get way too sappy and hokey from the midpoint on, but held out hopes that the raunchy, raucous and awkward R-rated humor would continue to build throughout the film. It didn't. This movie doesn't begin to illustrate just how funny Amy Schumer and Bill Hader are, or can be. And as is the case with all Apatow films, Trainwreck is entirely too long. I lost interest the last 45 minutes to an hour. Colin Quinn (opening scene) and John Cena steal the show.
Incisively funny, but not without heart, TRAINWRECK coasts breezily on the shoulders of Amy Schumer and an impressive supporting cast.
The beginning is over the top gross and detracks from the storyline.
If you take out the 15 minutes of standup-worthy humor, you're left with a poorly executed romantic comedy that does not quit and merely inaugurates Ms. Schumer as the female Adam Sandler.
Seriously, one of the funniest movies of the year!! Go see it!!

Am Schumer is as awesome as you think she would be, what with her fresh and funny take on modern womanhood. Bill Hader tones down the creepo factor just enough to be somewhat likeable, if not entirely odd and charming. With a slew of celebrity cameos, John Cena and Amare Stodamire steal the show. Lebron should really stick to Gatorade commercials; his jokes, which were obviously written for him, went largely silent in the theater I watched it in.

A great insight into Amy's life and experiences, she made me laugh and cry, and she made me think about relationships! Tilda Swinton, great and quirky performance here. Brie Larson, warm and sincere. Bill is heart warming as the dorky, but good Dr. Amy is superb, real, no holds barred, truthful and lets us see her faults and how she handles them. Must see, and note lots of great laughs and adult humour!
The phrase "don't judge a book by its cover" would apply to this movie. It didn't seem all that appealing from the trailers, but the actual film was a heck of a good time.

In "trainwreck", Shumer is the girlfriend many guys always wanted but ALL mothers feared. Hilarious, shining, and alternately hard-hearted andscary, Shumer does indeed play a kind of woman that actually exists - one with some terrible flaws and warts, but who is also brilliant and a person you want to know better. One warning - just going by the trailer you might think this is a laugh-out-loud slapstick comedy from start to finish. Honestly, my female friend I saw this with called it a "dram-com" instead of a "rom-com" as most critics are labeling it. There is some serious issues going on here with Shumer's almost pathological unwillingness to commit (even for a good night kiss after a date), but I also laughed out loud more during the 2 wonderful hours spent with Shumer and her co-star, Bill Hader, than I have in any other movie this year. Absolutely worth at least one viewing and I'll probably go back for another show - or two.

I'm not really big on chick flicks. Not because I don't like stories about love-most movies have some sort of love story-it's more of the cliches, cardboard characters and corny dialogue of chick flicks that turn me off. Fortunately Trainwreck avoids most of these chick flick pratfalls and manages to be a pretty entertaining comedy.All of the actors are good here. I usually find the over-the-top smart-assy female character thing that's become popular in modern comedies (think Melissa McCarthy) annoying, and was expecting that in this film from Schumer, but thankfully she didn't really go that route, instead it's a more believable performance of a damaged woman who still loves the father who made it impossible for her to have a meaningful relationship with a man. Bill Hader is great here as the regular guy who falls in love with her. He plays straight laced just as well as he does gay (if you haven't checked out Skeleton Twins, give it a go, Hader's phenomenal in it). There's also a surprising supporting role by Lebron James. The surprising thing isn't necessarily that Lebron is in the film as a supporting character (not a cameo), the surprising thing is that Lebron is good. He plays the best friend of Hader's character, an athletic surgeon who works on professional athletes. Lebron's the best friend who just wants his buddy to be happy. That's it, and the comedy comes from just how good at playing that role he is. This part of the film is incredibly well done.The only issues I have with Trainwreck are that it follows the chick flick formula of: Meet, fall in love, fight, get back together, end. Which in of itself isn't necessarily a bad thing if you can make me forget that you're doing that, but this film didn't. It's comedy is fairly funny (sometimes it feels like it's trying to be edgy for edgy's sake), but I just didn't have a big enough emotional connection with Schumer's character to care if she got back together with Hader. Another problem was that their fight wasn't big enough to make me feel like there was no way they would get back together. It was a normal couple fight, not a "we're done" fight, that every chick flick needs. So when they get back together it feels too normal for me to really care. But if you're just looking for a good comedy, this one is miles above most other modern comedies, and just has a few of the usual chick flick problems.

Coming from someone who was NOT a fan of Amy NOR Hader, I found it consistently funny & entertaining. Underneath the myriad of crude (mostly sexual, still hilarious) jokes, it manages to stay not only sweet, but also sophisticated - and more honest & open about the human condition than most dramas. Not to mention the guest cast members were all amazing, especially LeBron & John Cena!

am I the only one that thought this movie was based on total bull? a emotionally immature slut gets the best guy in NYC? Let alone a orthopedic surgeon to top athletes?? please, I get it, its just a movie but i found Jurassic Park more believable. --there I said it.

The best thing I really have to say about this movie is just how much of a sappy romantic comedy this movie is. It really is. My expectations going in were raunchy humor, lots of sex, and a John Cena cameo and what I got is heart. Also, way too much John Cena. Way too much. There's no more "You Can't See Me." It's extremely disturbing. Please, wear your jorts at all times, sir.What really involved me in the viewing of this movie is how fundamentally grounded everyone was. Sure, a lot of people in Amy's life have cartoonish elements, but they're also people and you can just feel that in the dialogues and jokes and character touches. Well, all but two. Two characters were just one-dimensional walking jokes. Everyone else, though. Yes, I'm looking at you LeBron, Dave Atell. Method Man. Staten Island Breakfast Guy. And holy hell, Colin Quinn. Best role he's ever had. Talk about playing against type!In summary, Amy Schumer and Bill Hader are magic from their first minute sharing a scene together, and their friends and families help support and shape these people and let you in on who they are without any need to resort to expositing. It's energetic, wild, crass, tearjerking, awkward, hilarious, empathetic, silly, and wonderful. I thought I had watched some amazing movies this year, but this might be my number one.Just so long as Cena wears his jorts. I really don't want to see him holding up a towel ever again. I don't know where that's been.
Big improvement from This is 40 mostly thanks to Schumer and Hader, but I'd like Apatow's next movie to be set in a non upper-class white world, you know, just to mix things up a smidge.

A must see movie for all the twenty something young women I know. Schumer does a great job of upending the expectations of being a 'young lady'. Raunchy enough to offend but certainly worth the ticket price and almost certain to give you a summer smile.

I didn't care for this movie, however, other people I went with really like it. Amy is painfully plain in my opinion, so it was difficult to get into the story line. This movie is extremely predictable!

I was actually really surprised by the emotional depth in this film and by the end of it I was partially in love with everything about it. I would say by a thread hair this is Judd Apatow's best film to date. it's very funny in parts even if not ever single joke hits the mark perfectly, but it almost does. Everything else aside from that is perfect here from the casting to cinematography to music choices. I wasn't really expecting all this to come out of a comedy and perhaps Apatow could get an oscar nom for this screenplay alone, I would say. If you see the trailer for this and think the best parts will be there you will be wrong. This is the perfect example of a dramedy romance gone right and made for everyone no less--over 18, I would say. It does have some slightly dark moments and is a bit mean-spirited in some ways, but as a whole at the center of it all, there is a huge heart to this tale. Don't miss it. Easily one of my favorites of the year so far.
MUST SEE! Great movie for date night!!
Very funny! Def watch!
A couple of dead moments, but HILARIOUIS (Raunchy)

I like Appatow. Only he can do what he does and he consistently offers a fascinating, grounded and well-crafted view of a world often neglected by similar genre films. Trainwreck is quite possibly one of his most accomplished features.

I like her, she seems so real and natural. But I'm a little bit tired of her feminist jokes all the time, too typical, nothing fresh and sparkling. This film is stupid and boring, ( i felt asleep in the middle) Amy lost herself between fame and reason. The script had some potential, but it never happened. But I'm glad for her, at least they paid her really well.

Good story line, but the delivery missed the target. This seemed more like a vehicle for Amy Schumer's stand up comedy. Surprising performance by LeBron James. Too sporadic, scenes do not transition well. Could have been much better.
A bit too long but still haven't seen a bad Apatow movie.

Amy is funny but how much of a leading woman is she? Most of the time you feel like you're watching a someone's who's not so easy to relate to, and that alienates a big portion of the audience from enjoying the journey of their lead. Trainwreck has it's very funny moments though, all thanks to a great supporting cast, led by Bill Hader and made very powerful by a very funny Lebron James, who could easily lead his own comedies in the near future.

Rating: 4 out 5 - A surprise hit! Great flick about Amy who is literally a trainwreck, she loves life way too much and has no plans to fall in love until she meets her man through a job assignment that she wasn't expecting to get. The cast nails their roles perfectly and the real surprise in this movie is the comedic acting chops of LeBron James. You really need to watch this film just for LeBron. Overall this very funny romantic comedy serves its purpose of being a fun movie. The cameos in this film are fantastic and warming to see some old faces back on the screen.
I hate Amy Schumer and do not find her funny one bit.

it's been drilled into Amy's head by her rascal of a dad that monogamy isn't realistic. Then she meets successful and charming sports doctor, and all the extra fucking must stop. Cause shes in Love... Yikes. Must see movie.

Does this count as a romantic comedy? Because if so it's the best romantic comedy in the history of histories. Amy Schumer has far more range than you could ever expect. LeBron James is amazingly, shockingly funny in this. John Cena is amazingly, shockingly naked in this (and also pretty damn funny too).
Extremely entertaining and funny. The ending scene had me laughing so hard that I had tears.

In a lot of ways I feel this is what Apatow wanted out of This Is 40 in terms of quality. The cast was pretty strong especially Bill Hader and dat Brie Larson. There's a lot of hype for Amy Schumer, but I thought she was pretty good. Also you would have never guessed that Tilda Swinton was in this because holy sh**...she was a totally different person. The jokes were good, there's a couple of scenes that made me laugh out loud but that was about it. It's more drama than comedy but overall, it makes for a solid movie.
Started out with a lot of distasteful sex scenes, and the plot was very predictable. The ending was disappointing. The title speaks for itself.

Very disappointing film...I was, at the very least, expecting something rather crude and something that would take risks (like everything I've seen from Amy Schumer before), and instead I got a very tame, safe, and often boring rom/com. Sure, there were a couple of funny moments, but there was way too much lag in between...and, the last 20 minutes or so were just lame. I had high hopes for this film going in, but I was mostly bored and even checked my phone a couple of times to see how much longer was left. Then, I rewatched the trailer for it and realized that the funniest parts of the trailer aren't even in the movie ("You dress him like that so no one wants to f�ck him? // "I f�cked a bunch of fat guys" // most of the LeBron/Bill Hader dialogue). Now it makes me wonder if they took a hacksaw to the film and cut all the funny stuff and that's why we were left with a snorefest? Warning: possible plot-spoiler, even if the plot is gossamer-thin in this case.This is a fearless, no-holds barred comedy that does what a comedy is supposed to do: has you LOL in your seat over and over; it delivers, and its star is wonderful. It skewers and taunts the whole concept of modern romance whileseemingly extolling the very values it claims are so phony. The movie can be enjoyed as pure comedy or it could be taken as satire. It could be analyzed to death by critics as just a Harlequin Romance disguised as a clever comedy, for the storyline is ultimately about as simplistic as those corny little books that lovelorn gals (and guys?) would read to counter the tedium of 9-5 jobs. Every character in the movie looks like someone we have known or seen in real life; Tilda Swinton nearly steals the movie as the barracuda-like boss of the sleazy men's magazine "Amy" (Schumer's character) works for. However, all the other supporting actors were good as well, including Brie Larson playing Amy's sister, who chose the conventional marriage/children route rather than Amy's free-wheeling, promiscuous, hard-partying lifestyle. It is easy to see where this "trainwreck" is heading very early on in the story as "Amy" is sort of a sex addict/alcoholic and commitment-phobic, but it is a pretty consistently hilarious ride. It's essentially the same old fairy tale fantasy rehashed for maximal laughs: one day she will meet a well-to-do Prince with a fabulous career who will take care of her and the ugly duckling, weird, oddball girl will be, magically, transformed into a caring, committed, upscale queen minus all the unsavory, nasty habits of a really screwed up person. This is a movie in which every character looks so deliberately and imperfectly human they look like characters come alive in a wax museum, all make-up and artifice and witty eccentricity. Still, it's a rollicking, enjoyable train ride and a lot of fun at the movies, a twisted fairy tale that delivers the laughs. It's the funniest comedy I've seen since Bridesmaids.

Trainwreck hits all the right beats of a standard progressive Judd Apatow rom-com. It takes a while for the movie to find its sweet spot, but once it does, the laughs hit one after the other. And what a pleasant surprise was LeBron James's performance too. The guy can act.
Hilarious! Laugh out loud funny. I wish I could unsee so I could see it again!

Sharp, hilarious writing make for a good time to be had by all.
a hysterically comedy with major stars!!!

Roger, you're kidding, right? The characters were unbelievable at best (who jokes about almost everything at almost all times with almost everyone?), the plot was barely existent, the ironic tropes were vomit inducting (I can't hail a cab in two tries so I guess I have to sprint to keep in step with an artificial time constraint to get into a cheerleader uniform to get the guy - what??) and BH was so restrained, I couldn't tell if he was actually trying to be that unfunny (what happened to the hilarious comedic timing of "Forgetting Sarah Marshall"??) or was just heavily sedated by horse tranquilizers. I look like Mark Wahlberg ATE Mark Wahlberg!" Well done, JC. You were the savior of this film (too soon?).

Just a brutal 100% chick flick. I was duped into seeing it by her pretty funny TV show and what I got was a pile of cartoon character jackass guys, strong woman and 1/2 a movie of weepies. Absolutely the most painful thing I've sat through since I took my daughter to one of the Twilight movies.
This movie was absolutely hilarious. It's the best of Amy Schumer's crude self-deprecating humor. It also had some amazing cameos!

"Trainwreck" is predicated on the mantra "monogamy isn't realistic." That is the line Amy's father preaches to her and her sister, and it is a line Amy Schumer's character lives by in real life. Amy works as a columnist at a human interest magazine and is assigned to cover a sports doctor (Bill Hader). She lives a cavalier lifestyle, basically doing whatever and whomever, whenever she pleases. However, once she meets Hader, she starts to develop real feelings for him and is torn between her free roaming old habits and wanting to settle down with a guy once and for all. Schumer plays an honest, believable role as a woman in New York trying to make it in her own coming-of-age way. She is relatable and has many of the same problems that we all have. I laud this film for its sincerity. There are also come pro sports cameos, such as Tony Romo and Marv Albert. Lebron James also plays a significant role in the film as Hader's confidant. Overall, this is a lively, spirited film full of pizazz and zest. The comedic gold is natural and though much of the humor is sexual, its not obnoxious or over-the-top. A must watch for anyone struggling with a mid-life or early-life crisis ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ B+

during one of the biggest droughts in comedy movie history, comedian amy schumer gets her serious debut as an actress in Trainwreck, and the results are hysterical. This is essentially a biopic; and you have to give it up for amy for the bravery, talent, and effort that she put into this film. From the celebrity cameos (a specifically brilliant cameo was the John Cena addition, nice one amy), to the filthy yet horrifyingly relevant jokes spread throughout, the film is an absolute delight. As the movie goes on, it becomes more focused on the unique characters. The plot isn't anything special, neither is the camera work necessarily, but it simply doesn't matter in the end. The reason that train wreck is such a gem, is that its so brutally honest. The slight racism, strong sexism, and toilet humor blend together to make a perfect mix of laughs, ones from the belly, and ones from the mind.

Amy Schumer is the funniest woman alive. Trainwreck is not just hilarious but poignant. Judd Apatow delivers as always, though moreso than his last two or three films. And while this one borrows from his past works stylistically, Amy's signature brand of humor is more prevalent than his directing presence. The Cast of SNL almun helps, as well as Lebron and Amar'e Stoudemire's scene-stealing supporting roles. Definitely evokes as much laughter as her brilliant show on Comedy Central.

Best chick flick of 2015. Amy Schumer delivers a knock out performance through a variety of hilarious scenes interspersed with poignant and heartfelt moments all of which help her character grow and mature throughout the movie.

I will be the first one to say that I only went to see this movie because of Jenny. I have watched Amy Schumer's comedy and I have not been a fan until now. This was a great film it had everything you could want and more. I laughed, I cried, and it even made me sort of like Lebron James and everyone knows I loathe him just a little. Amy is definitely a HOT MESS but she knows it and owns it which makes you feel for her. Growing up her dad told her monogamy was not realistic and she her sister took his advice differently. Amy believed his words and made sure she never stuck to monogamy. When she meets Aaron Conners (Bill Hader) she is not happy to write an article about a sports doctor. Aaron is quirky and doesn't seem to realize what a big deal he is. He sees the best in people and is the polar opposite of Amy. The banter between Amy and Aaron is hysterical you can't stop laughing and I am pretty sure I missed some jokes between the laughter.The cast is great from Tilda Swinton as Dianna, Amy's crazy boss, John Cena as Steven, Amy's body building boy toy who might be a little gay. Brie Larson as Kim, Amy's loving sister who believes in love. Colin Quinn as Gordon, is Amy's dad who is a cranky, hysterical, and over the top. Vanessa Bayer as Nikki, Amy's best friend are just some of the amazing cast members in this movie.I loved this movie more than words that can express and I give it 5 diamonds, it was breath of fresh air and I hope to see more fun movies from Amy Schumer.
It's nothing groundbreaking, but Trainwreck soars over most comedies with its talented writing, touching subplot and knockout/hilarious performances by Amy Schumer, Bill Hader, and Lebron James.

I am new to Amy Schumer (I know, late to the party again), but this film will provide the rest of the population who don't know her well a perfect dose of her humor. This was a showcase not only for her talents but for Bill Hader (whose talent seems endless), Jon Cena (who knew he had any?), LeBron James (ditto), and for all the folks who had smaller parts (her family, her office staff). Because of reviews I had read, I had low expectations for the ending, but ultimately I was very happy with it! The right amount of cheeseball to make me smile and tear up. (It's a rom-com....I'm not giving away the ending.) Bravo--can't want to see what else she creates.
Super Fresh! What i expected from Judd.And good job Amy.

Not since Knocked Up have I been so pleasantly surprised by a low-key comedy! Trainwreck is a fun flick with taut one-liners and strong performances. Amy Shumer brings her balls-to-the-wall, foul-mouthed comedic talent to the big screen with aplomb, and she is ably matched at every step by Bill Hader. But for me, it is the cameo-ish roles that did the trick. Daniel Radcliffe and Marisa Tomei were great in the 'movie-within-the-movie', and LeBron James was surprisingly good with his comedic timing. However, the pi�ce de r�sistance was John Cena with his random and utterly-inappropriate lines. Who knew he could be so good in a comedic role!Trainwreck is a refreshing departure from the typical toilet humour that seems to be going around, and is great for an audience that is looking for a fun ride

Even when it wasn't funny, it never annoyed me, which for modern comedies is saying something.
